description: Known data anomalies in CCCBDB source HTML pages and their resolution status. Most are parser-fixable issues in the upstream HTML, not genuine data errors. See ANOMALY_LOG.md for peer-reviewable documentation.

anomalies.description: Br's z-coordinate is   in Cartesian table. Only P extracted (1 of 2 atoms).
anomalies.evidence: expgeom2x.html Cartesian table: P1 has full coordinates (0,0,0), but Br2's z-coordinate is   instead of numeric value
anomalies.resolution: Parser reconstructs Br position from internal coordinates table (rPBr=2.171 angstrom). Second atom placed at (0,0,2.171).

anomalies.description: Furfural page states 'No coordinate data available'. Only 1 of 11 atoms (O) in Cartesian table.
anomalies.evidence: expgeom2x.html explicitly states 'No coordinate data available'. Only O1 extracted.
anomalies.resolution: No parser fix possible. Calculated geometry fallback used as best_available.

anomalies.description: Ethanethiol experimental geometry has two conformers concatenated in one table — 18 atoms instead of 9.
anomalies.evidence: expgeom2x.html Cartesian table has 18 rows; atom labels restart at row 10 (C1 appears twice)
anomalies.resolution: Parser detects label restart and takes only first conformer (9 atoms).

anomalies.description: Allyl Fluoride experimental geometry has two conformers concatenated — 18 atoms instead of 9.
anomalies.evidence: expgeom2x.html Cartesian table has 18 rows with label restart
anomalies.resolution: Parser detects label restart and takes only first conformer (9 atoms).

anomalies.description: 1,1,2,2-Tetrafluoroethane experimental geometry has two conformers concatenated — 16 atoms instead of 8.
anomalies.evidence: expgeom2x.html Cartesian table has 16 rows with label restart
anomalies.resolution: Parser detects label restart and takes only first conformer (8 atoms).

anomalies.description: Trisulfane experimental geometry has two conformers concatenated — 10 atoms instead of 5.
anomalies.evidence: expgeom2x.html Cartesian table has 10 rows with label restart
anomalies.resolution: Parser detects label restart and takes only first conformer (5 atoms).

anomalies.description: Thiohydroxylamine experimental geometry has two conformers concatenated — 10 atoms instead of 5.
anomalies.evidence: expgeom2x.html Cartesian table has 10 rows with label restart
anomalies.resolution: Parser detects label restart and takes only first conformer (5 atoms).

anomalies.description: ZnCN has 43 electrons (odd) but CCCBDB reports 'closed shell' / singlet — violates electron parity. Confirmed as upstream spin label error (not wrong charge) by three independent evidence sources.
anomalies.evidence: (1) Electron parity: Zn(30)+C(6)+N(7)=43 electrons (odd), cannot be singlet. (2) spin2x.html states 'ZnNC (Zinc isocyanide) is closed shell. S^2=0.' (3) energy2x.html provides ROHF (Restricted Open-shell Hartree-Fock) energies — a method exclusively for open-shell systems — confirming CCCBDB internally treats this molecule as open-shell despite the spin page label. HF/3-21G=-1860.945896 vs ROHF/3-21G=-1860.945491 (different, confirming open-shell). Alternative hypothesis (wrong charge) ruled out: all URL parameters use charge=0, no CNZn+/CNZn- entries exist in the 2,186-species list.
anomalies.resolution: Parser checks electron parity before trusting 'closed shell' text. Odd electrons -> return None -> spin stored as {} (attempted, no valid data).

anomalies.description: Trideuteroamine (ND3) calculated geometry includes a dummy atom 'X' — 5 atoms instead of 4.
anomalies.evidence: geom3x.html contains atom 'X1' at (0, 0, 1.1195) which is a computational reference point, not a real atom
anomalies.resolution: Parser filters atoms with symbol 'X' during coordinate extraction.

anomalies.description: Bromine atom geometry page labels the atom as 'D1' instead of 'Br1'. Affects Br, Br+, and Br- (all charge variants).
anomalies.evidence: expgeom2x.html Cartesian table has label 'D1' but formula and page title say 'Bromine atom'
anomalies.resolution: Parser validates single-atom element against formula. Mismatch ('D' vs 'Br') corrected to formula element.

anomalies.description: Bromine cation geometry page labels the atom as 'D1' instead of 'Br1'.
anomalies.evidence: expgeom2x.html Cartesian table has label 'D1' but formula is Br
anomalies.resolution: Parser validates single-atom element against formula. Mismatch corrected.

anomalies.description: Bromine anion geometry page labels the atom as 'D1' instead of 'Br1'.
anomalies.evidence: expgeom2x.html Cartesian table has label 'D1' but formula is Br
anomalies.resolution: Parser validates single-atom element against formula. Mismatch corrected.

anomalies.description: TiO experimental geometry labels both atoms as Ti (Ti1, Ti2) instead of O1, Ti2. Coordinates are correct; only element labels are wrong.
anomalies.evidence: expgeom2x.html Cartesian table has {Ti:2} but formula OTi implies {O:1, Ti:1}. Internal coordinates table says 'rO=Ti' confirming atom 1 is O and atom 2 is Ti.
anomalies.resolution: Element labels corrected using internal coordinate descriptions (rO=Ti -> atom 1 is O, atom 2 is Ti). Experimental geometry preserved with corrected elements.

anomalies.description: CCSD(T)=FULL/STO-3G and CCSD(T)=FULL/6-31G* report identical energy (-39.806897 hartree). Different basis sets should produce different energies — likely a data copy error in CCCBDB.
anomalies.evidence: energy2x.html: both STO-3G and 6-31G* columns for CCSD(T)=FULL show -39.806897. All other methods show different values for these two basis sets.
anomalies.resolution: Faithfully reproduced from HTML. No parser fix applied. Researchers should treat the CCSD(T)=FULL/6-31G* value for CH4 as unreliable.

anomalies.description: Fe reported as closed shell (multiplicity=1, S^2=0). Atomic iron ground state is 5D4 (multiplicity=5, four unpaired 3d electrons). Archived spin2x.html confirms CCCBDB genuinely reports 'Fe (Iron atom) is closed shell. S^2=0' — upstream data error.
anomalies.evidence: molecule.json: spin={S_squared:0.0, closed_shell:true, multiplicity:1}. Fe has 26 electrons (even, so parity check passes). Known ground state: [Ar]3d6 4s2, term symbol 5D4, multiplicity 5. spin2x.html archived and confirms 'Fe (Iron atom) is closed shell. S^2=0.'
anomalies.resolution: Faithfully reproduced from CCCBDB spin page (upstream error confirmed via archived HTML). Researchers should not trust Fe's spin/multiplicity values.

anomalies.description: CAS 137019869 appears to be a typo of CAS 13709869 (extra digit '1'). This entry has no energy data and no geometry data. The valid entry is BF3H3N_13709869 with full data.
anomalies.evidence: BF3H3N_137019869: name='Boron trifluoride monoammoniate', energy=None, geometry=None. BF3H3N_13709869: name='Amminetrifluoroboron', energy has 28 methods, geometry=CCSD(T)=FULL/aug-cc-pVDZ. CAS numbers differ by one inserted digit.
anomalies.resolution: Both entries faithfully mirrored from CCCBDB species list. Empty entry retained for completeness.

anomalies.description: B12H12^2- appears under two CAS numbers (12356137 and 84912390). Initially suspected as duplicate, but CAS lookup confirms these are different salts: CAS 12356-13-7 = lithium dodecaborate (Li2B12H12), CAS 84912-39-0 = cesium dodecaborate (Cs2B12H12). CCCBDB strips the counterion and treats both as the bare B12H12^2- anion.
anomalies.evidence: CAS 12356-13-7 confirmed as Li2B12H12 via CAS Common Chemistry / Chemsrc. CAS 84912-39-0 confirmed as Cs2B12H12 via Wikipedia / ACS Molecule of the Week. Different counterions explain different data availability (4 vs 25 energy methods).
anomalies.resolution: Not a duplicate. Two distinct salts of the same anion, legitimately listed as separate CCCBDB entries.

anomalies.description: C3+ (carbon trimer cation, 17e doublet) has CCSD(T) S^2=1.823, far from ideal 0.75. No after-annihilation value available.
anomalies.evidence:
spin2x.html CCSD(T) row: '1.850
 ' (STO-3G) and '1.823
 ' (6-31+G**). No after-annihilation values. Parser selects 1.823 from highest-ranked basis. 17 electrons = odd → doublet is correct multiplicity.
anomalies.resolution: Legitimate severe spin contamination in CCCBDB data. Whitelisted in test_s_squared_vs_multiplicity.

anomalies.description: CSi- (silicon monocarbide anion, 21e doublet) has CCSD(T)=FULL S^2=1.751, far from ideal 0.75. No after-annihilation value available.
anomalies.evidence:
spin2x.html CCSD(T)=FULL row: '1.751
 ' in two basis sets. No after-annihilation values. 21 electrons = odd → doublet is correct multiplicity.
anomalies.resolution: Legitimate severe spin contamination in CCCBDB data. Whitelisted in test_s_squared_vs_multiplicity.
